newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Umax Jan-April sales up 205 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Umax Jan-April sales up 205 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Taiwan manufacturer Umax Data Systems Inc said on Thursday sales in the the first four months of 1997 soared 205 percent to T$4.2 billion from the year-earlier period.
In April alone, Umax posted sales of T$1.203 billion, up 226 percent from T$368 million in April 1996, the firm said in a statement.
It did not provide profit figures.
Umax has said it hopes its 1997 sales will exceed T$10 billion.
The company expects its image scanners -- its main product -- to maintain 40 percent growth in 1997 due to rising global demand.
It also saw its new products -- computers based on Apple Computer Inc's Macintosh series -- enjoying sharp growth in 1997, it said.
Umax and its U.S. unit, Umax Computer Corp, are among several Asian manufacturers licensed to design and make Mac-compatible "clones" that run on Apple's popular Mac OS operating system.
